The expert reviewed data from the busine: backed Tax Foundation, which tracked from 1981 through 2005 how much each state gets back in expenditures for every dollar sent in taxes to the federal government.
The expert found that New Jersey receive: 1.51 for every dollar each state sent to Washington in 2005, supporting the claim made by Governor Chris Christie.
The expert noted that Kentucky: s higher rate of federal funding may be attributed to the presence of two military bases in the state, Fort Campbell and Fort Knox.
The expert analyzed the Tax Foundation: s 25 years' worth of data and found that New Jersey consistently had a lower rate of return on dollars sent to Washington, while Kentucky's rate increased over the years, moving from 23rd place to 9th place among all states.
